channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DHS is urging DACA recipients to self-deport
item.description: "DACA does not confer any form of legal status in this country," said DHS assistant press secretary Tricia McLaughlin, who then encouraged "every pers...

item.title: Gunman Storms Manhattan Skyscraper, and Harvard Considers Potential $500 Million Deal
item.description: Plus, when the peanut M&M was in trouble.

item.title: ‘Worst-Case Scenario of Famine’ Unfolding in Gaza, U.N.-Backed Body Says
item.description: Access to food has plummeted to unprecedented levels, a monitoring group warned, as global outrage over Israel’s aid restrictions persisted.

item.title: Gunman Fatally Shoots Officer and 3 Others in Midtown Office Tower
item.description: The gunman, armed with an assault rifle, walked into the lobby and killed a police officer and two others. He killed another person on the 33rd floor ...

item.title: Trump lawsuit against Murdoch and 'Wall Street Journal' turns personal
item.description: Trump says he personally told his "very good friend Rupert Murdoch" that he had not sent a racy birthday greeting two decades ago to Jeffrey Epstein. ...

item.title: Russian Strike on Prison Kills 16, Ukraine Says
item.description: The attack, which came just hours after President Trump gave the Kremlin a new deadline to work toward ending the war, was part of a wave across the c...

item.title: Europe Made Major Trade Concessions to Trump. How Did That Happen?
item.description: Some European politicians are dismayed that the European Union did not drive a harder bargain, but facing the threat of a damaging trade war, official...

item.title: Hall of Fame second baseman Ryne Sandberg has died after battling cancer
item.description: Ryne Sandberg, a Hall of Fame second baseman who became one of baseball's best all-around players while starring for the Chicago Cubs, has died. He wa...

item.title: As Gaza starves, the next generation may also endure the consequences
item.description: U.N. officials say many people in Gaza are experiencing "famine-like conditions." Health experts who have studied past famines warn that the fallout c...

item.title: Shooter opens fire outside Reno casino, killing 3 and injuring several others
item.description: A gunman opened fire Monday outside the largest casino in Reno, Nevada, killing three people and wounding three others before police shot the suspect ...

item.title: North Korea Says Kim’s Relations With Trump ‘Not Bad,’ but Stands Firm on Nukes
item.description: The country appeared to signal an openness to talks, but said it must be recognized as a nuclear power and would not discuss abandoning its arsenal.

item.title: Russian Strike on Prison Kills 16, Ukraine Says

item.title: Heavy Rain and Flooding in China Kill at Least 30
item.description: The rains set off flooding and landslides, forcing tens of thousands of people to flee their homes in the capital and neighboring Hebei Province.

item.title: Deadly Flooding Inundates Beijing
item.description: Severe rains caused flooding and landslides in Beijing and surrounding areas, leaving homes destroyed as mass evacuations were underway.
